text:
Hi everyone :slightly_smiling_face:

Does anyone know what the 'objectWriteTraceId' property stands for, how to use it ?
I found it there in the create request :  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/line-items>

Thanks !

What's the deal with this custom object internal name? its supposed to be used with API calls but there's not a single api endpoint that works with that internal name, you have to go into one custom object crm page and use the value that you see in the url bar (something like 2-133664917) to fetch those objects (and if you have a sandbox account, that value is different cause it's auto-generated)
<@UJJ239SC9> graphql was the answer! Thank you so much

Hi, anyone know how to associate specific contacts to tickets, based on their company-to-contact label?

Not sure I'm going about this the right way so open to suggestions, but basically we add labels to contacts at the company level e.g. Owner.

We have workflows that create tickets based off company properties e.g. a date property. However running into the issue of having to associate all contacts related to that company or none. Would love to be able to only associate the specific contact e.g. Owner

Played around with the custom code actions in HS, but not getting much progress.  I suspect this has been solved/completed before so would love to hear from anyone who has the solution or advice :slightly_smiling_face:

Hello everyone :wave: I was wondering if you could help me with email events.

I'm trying to re-create the metrics from the <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/email/get_campaign_data> endpoint using the event endpoint <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/email/get_events> but I seem to be hitting some issues, specifically regarding the
*Unique reliable opens* & *Unique reliable clicks.*

Is there are way to re-create these metrics using the event data? Thanks :smile:
Yes - that is what you would do.
Send me a DM - I've got some Q's
Incredible. Thank you for giving me hope that I’m not a complete moron!!
I've been wanting to do a tutorial on Association API for quite some time now.  It's one of the most confusing API's in my opinion.
I would definitely take part in that

One question I had was does it really matter the direction of association?

Deal to Company Association vs a Company to Deal Association?
Not really, but this is all done in a HubSpot workflow, so it will be standardized
It's the same association but the Association ID will matter depending on the direction of the association.

Hey everyone! Sending a friendly reminder to provide feedback on your experience with the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions|custom workflow action API> and any other wishlist items you have in the <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSegfw484-sfPWfRPy5Msn0jvy5cx4-ZH60O0l0XpdtyJaE9Gw/viewform|form here>. We really want to hear your feedback! :smile:

(previous <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1725042579294259|slack message> for reference)
